Posts.Title: second breast opp and axillery clearance

Posts.Content: hello all, I'm new to this site in that I only joined tonight but have looked at the site for advice and info several times. I was diagnosed with Breasy Cancer in September, had my first opp on 23rd October which involved a "wide local incision" removing a 1 cm ish lump and surrounding tissue and a "sentinal node" procedure. When I was first diagnosed my nodes were clear but they thought they would "take a look" and probably "cherry pick" one node while they were doing my breast opp. When I got the results approximately 10 days after the opp I was advised that they took 2 nodes and both were positive and that they would need to go back in and take more, I was also advised that the lump was 3cm and the surrounding tissue was also positive so they would need to go back in and take some more and I was graded as Grade3 very aggressive. I was also told I will now definately be having Chemo and also Radiotherapy. 27th November I had my second opp and axilleray clearance and am still in a bit of a state of shock as I felt really well after my first opp and back at work after 2 weeks, and was totally convinced that I would just be told I needed Radiotherapy. This time I have felt really rough and won't be going back to work for a little while yet and still very sore and swollen  and still wearing my bloody PJ's ! I am waiting for the next results due next Tuesday when hopefully I will be told that it has not spread elsewhere and when I can start my Chemo.
